info.title: Users
info.description:
User data will include information that is contained in a user account. It defines the hub access and role that different types of users have within the system. Hub access is used to restrict or define the locations within which a user can access or perform certain actions within the application. User attributes consist of ID, name, email, and status. There are five different types of roles that MileApp provides, and you can create a new custom role depending on your organization. The predefined roles are: 1. Finance 2. Owner 3. Planner 4. Admin 5. Field User Note: A user can only have one (1) role at a time but can be granted access to multiple hubs. **Below is detail each field for Body API Configuration** | Field | Type | Format | Description | |---|---|---|---| | _id | string | *24 characters of hexadecimal* | Unique identifier for the user
that generated by system.
**Example**: `6352736c628401059b37a2e2` | | name | string | | The user's full name.
**Example**: `Sophie` | | email | string | *String with Email Format*
`name@domain.com` | The user's email address.
**Example**: `shopie@mile.app` | | organizationId | string | *24 characters of hexadecimal* | The identifier for the organization
that generated by system.
**Example:** `634e98098ce07d29474a7e22`| | hubId | array of string | *24 characters of hexadecimal* | The identifier for the hub that generated by system.
Use GET /hubs API to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `['634e98498ce07d29474a7e29']` | | status | string | There are 3 types of status:
```active```,```inactive```,```pending``` | Used to indicate whether a user account or profile is currently active
and accessible within a system.
**Example:** `active` | | roleId | string | *24 characters of hexadecimal* | The identifier for the role that generated by system.
Use GET /roles API to get the list of Role IDs.
**Example:** `645e03ee8ef2eb1a5a161b93`| | createdTime | datetime | `Y-m-d\TH:i:s.vP` | Time at which the vehicle was created.
**Example:** `2022-10-07T03:00:58.623000Z`| | updatedTime | datetime | `Y-m-d\TH:i:s.vP` | Time at which the vehicle was updated.
**Example:** `2022-10-07T03:00:58.623000Z`| | isDeleted | boolean | | Has the value `true` if the vehicle was deleted.
Has the value `false` when vehicle still exist.
**Default:** `false` |
